article:
# Recipe: Instapot Teriyaki Chicken

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Instapot Teriyaki Chicken is a delicious and flavorful Japanese-inspired dish. It features tender chicken cooked in a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce. This recipe is perfect for those who want a quick and easy meal with minimal effort. The Instapot (Instant Pot) makes the cooking process fast and convenient, allowing you to enjoy a homemade teriyaki chicken in no time.

## Ingredients
- 1.5 lbs (680g) boneless, skinless chicken thighs
- 1/2 cup (120ml) soy sauce
- 1/4 cup (60ml) mirin (sweet rice wine)
- 1/4 cup (60ml) sake (Japanese rice wine)
- 2 tablespoons (30ml) honey
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
- Optional: sesame seeds and sliced green onions for garnish

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Mixing bowl
- Whisk
- Tongs
- Measuring cups and spoons

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes (including pressure build-up and release)

## Steps
1. In a mixing bowl, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, honey, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Whisk until well combined.
2. Cut the chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces and add them to the Instant Pot.
3. Pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over the chicken in the Instant Pot.
4. Close the lid of the Instant Pot and set the valve to the sealing position.
5. Select the "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" setting and set the cooking time to 10 minutes on high pressure.
6. Once the cooking time is complete, allow for a natural pressure release for 5 minutes, then carefully perform a quick pressure release.
7. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to create a slurry.
8. Set the Instant Pot to the "Saute" function and add the cornstarch slurry to the teriyaki sauce in the pot. Stir well to thicken the sauce.
9. Continue to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened to your desired consistency.
10. Turn off the Instant Pot and let the chicken sit in the sauce for a few minutes to absorb the flavors.
11. Serve the Instapot Teriyaki Chicken over steamed rice or noodles.
12. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions, if desired.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Teriyaki Chicken over steamed white rice or brown rice.
- Pair it with a side of steamed vegetables like broccoli, carrots, or snap peas.
- For a complete meal, serve with a side of miso soup and a fresh green salad.

## Variations
- For a healthier option, you can use chicken breast instead of chicken thighs.
- Add vegetables like bell peppers, onions, or mushrooms to the Instant Pot for added flavor and texture.
- For a spicy kick, add a teaspoon of sriracha or red pepper flakes to the teriyaki sauce.
- Substitute the honey with maple syrup or brown sugar for a different sweetness profile.

## Tips and Tricks
- For extra flavor, marinate the chicken in the teriyaki sauce for 30 minutes to overnight before cooking.
- Make sure to cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces to ensure even cooking.
- If you prefer a thicker sauce, you can increase the amount of cornstarch in the slurry.
- Adjust the sweetness of the teriyaki sauce by adding more or less honey according to your taste preference.
- Be cautious when performing a quick pressure release as the steam can be hot. Use a long spoon or tongs to turn the release valve.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information provided is approximate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used.
- Serving Size: 1/4 of the recipe
- Calories: 300
- Fat: 10g
- Carbohydrates: 15g
- Protein: 35g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the teriyaki chicken in the microwave or on the stovetop until heated through.
- The sauce may thicken when refrigerated, so you can add a splash of water or broth when reheating to loosen it up.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use chicken breast instead of chicken thighs?
   - Yes, you can use chicken breast if you prefer. Keep in mind that chicken breast tends to be leaner and may result in slightly drier meat compared to chicken thighs.

2. Can I make this recipe without an Instant Pot?
   - Yes, you can still make teriyaki chicken without an Instant Pot. Simply follow the same steps using a stovetop pressure cooker or a regular pot. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.

3. Can I use store-bought teriyaki sauce instead of making my own?
   - Yes, you can use store-bought teriyaki sauce if you're short on time. However, homemade teriyaki sauce will give you a fresher and more authentic flavor.

4. Can I freeze the leftovers?
   - Yes, you can freeze the teriyaki chicken for up to 3 months. Make sure to store it in an airtight container or freezer bags. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

Enjoy your homemade Instapot Teriyaki Chicken!
